channel.title: Tesla | Electrek
channel.description: EV and Tesla News, Green Energy, Ebikes, and more

item.title: Tesla (TSLA) announces record production and deliveries of over 305k Q4 vehicles, 936K for 2021
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla (TSLA) announced that it achieved both record production and deliveries during the last quarter of 2021.

The automaker produced “more than 305,000 electric vehicles and delivered of over 308,000 electric vehicles during Q4 2021.

more…

The post Tesla (TSLA) announces record production and deliveries of over 305k Q4 vehicles, 936K for 2021 appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla in 2022 is going to be about growth and battery cells
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
When I think about what Tesla’s upcoming 2022 year is going to look like, I think it will revolve around growth, much like 2021. But there will also be a renewed focus on securing battery cells in an even more competitive landscape.

more…

The post Tesla in 2022 is going to be about growth and battery cells appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla’s trunk latch and rear camera recalls extend to 200,000 more vehicles in China
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has started two recalls of almost 500,000 vehicles in the US due to a problem with its trunk latch and reverse camera.

Now we learn that the same recalls are extending to 200,000 more vehicles in China.

more…

The post Tesla’s trunk latch and rear camera recalls extend to 200,000 more vehicles in China appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla (TSLA) issues recalls on almost half a million Model 3 and Model S vehicles
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla (TSLA) has issued two recalls on almost half a million Model 3 and Model S vehicles.

The fixes are small, but it will still put a strain on its service team.

more…

The post Tesla (TSLA) issues recalls on almost half a million Model 3 and Model S vehicles appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: NYPD buys 184 Ford Mustang Mach-E, approves option to buy 250 Tesla Model 3s
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
New York City is closing out the year with a big electrification move as it adds 184 Ford Mustang Mach-E electric SUVs to its fleet, and it approves the option to buy 250 Tesla Model 3 electric sedans.

Most of the vehicles are going to the NYPD and other emergency service departments.

more…

The post NYPD buys 184 Ford Mustang Mach-E, approves option to buy 250 Tesla Model 3s appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla is sponsoring Formula SAE electric racing teams with free battery cells and more
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla is going to start sponsoring Formula SAE electric racing teams with free battery cells and discounted hardware.

The automaker has often hired former students who participated in these competitions.

more…

The post Tesla is sponsoring Formula SAE electric racing teams with free battery cells and more appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Elon Musk: Tesla Bot could develop a unique personality and become a companion
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Elon Musk says that he is considering Tesla Bot becoming more than just a humanoid robot to perform useful tasks but to have it potentially develop a unique personality and be a companion.

He says Tesla Bot could make an “incredible buddy like C3PO or R2D2.”

more…

The post Elon Musk: Tesla Bot could develop a unique personality and become a companion appeared first on Electrek.

item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:

item.title: Tesla releases rare blog about v11 holiday update with a surprise for non-Tesla owners
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has released a rare new blog post, something that doesn’t happen often since the company dissolved its PR department. In the post, Tesla releases more details about its v11 holiday software update, including something for non-Tesla owners.

The post Tesla releases rare blog about v11 holiday update with a surprise for non-Tesla owners appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla lets drivers turn their cars into megaphones with new software update
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has released a new software update that lets drivers use their Tesla vehicles as actual megaphones to communicate with their surroundings – so don’t be shocked if people start talking to you through their Tesla on the road.

more…

The post Tesla lets drivers turn their cars into megaphones with new software update appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla shuts down ‘passenger play’ that allows users to play video games on center screen while driving
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla confirmed that it will shut down “passenger play,” which allows for playing video games on the center screen of its vehicles while driving. The change comes after NHTSA announced that it is opening an official probe into the situation.

more…

The post Tesla shuts down ‘passenger play’ that allows users to play video games on center screen while driving appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla owner blows up his Model S with dynamite over $22,000 battery replacement
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
A Tesla Model S owner in Finland decided to blow up his electric car with dynamite after it needed a battery replacement, which Tesla said was going to cost $22,000.

more…

The post Tesla owner blows up his Model S with dynamite over $22,000 battery replacement appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla applies to install Supercharger stations in Texas with CCS connectors
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has applied to install Supercharger stations in Texas with CCS connectors, which would be a first in the US.

The move comes as Tesla is planning to open its Supercharger network to other automakers.

item.title: Tesla (TSLA) rises back to over $1 trillion valuation; Elon Musk says he’s still selling shares
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla’s stock (TSLA) has surged 7% today to rise back to over $1 trillion in market valuation. The reason behind the surge appeared to be Elon Musk saying that he is done selling the stock, but the CEO actually corrected his statement.

The post Tesla (TSLA) rises back to over $1 trillion valuation; Elon Musk says he’s still selling shares appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Elon Musk says he sold enough Tesla (TSLA) shares after exercising another $1.9 billion worth in options
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Elon Musk says he sold enough Tesla (TSLA) shares to “get around to 10%” – which was the amount he said he would sell as part of his controversial Twitter poll.

The CEO is actually far from 10%, but the whole situation is murky.

item.title: Tesla Model Y achieves highest possible IIHS safety rating
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS), the main independent organization that conducts crash tests on vehicles in the US, released the result of its latest tests on the Tesla Model Y and confirmed that it achieved the highest possible safety rating.

Chinese battery cell manufacturer Gotion High-Tech confirmed that it entered into a very important deal to supply LFP battery cells to an unnamed “large US automaker” and partner with that automaker to deploy US production of LFP battery cells.

Tesla is rumored to be that unnamed automaker.

item.title: Here’s every electric vehicle that currently qualifies for the US federal tax credit
item.dc:creator: Scooter Doll
item.description:
As sales of electric vehicles continue to surge, many new and prospective customers have questions about qualifying for federal tax credit on electric vehicles.

Whether you qualify is not a simple yes or no question… well, actually it sort of is, but the amount you may qualify for varies by household due to a number of different factors. Furthermore, there are other potential savings available to you that you might not even know about yet.

more…

The post Here’s every electric vehicle that currently qualifies for the US federal tax credit appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Idiots use Tesla Autopilot to put dog in danger in attempt to go viral
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Young adults on social media put a dog in the driver’s seat of a Tesla Model X on Autopilot, putting the animal and everyone else on the road in danger, in an attempt to go viral.

The case could be considered animal abuse on top of a serious traffic violation.

item.title: Tesla recalls 21,599 Model Ys made in China, citing steering knuckle issues
item.dc:creator: Scooter Doll
item.description:
According to a statement from China’s State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR), Tesla Shanghai filed a recall plan for 21,599 Model Y EVs manufactured in the country. The automaker cited issues pertaining to the strength of front and rear steering knuckles, stating they may not meet the automaker’s design requirements.

more…

item.title: Full Self-Driving Diary: A longtime Tesla driver’s perspective on FSD beta
item.dc:creator: Chance Miller
item.description:
After a month of safe and cautious driving, I finally achieved a Safety Score of 99 last week, and shortly thereafter, I was granted access to the Full Self-Driving Beta for my 2021 Model Y. The experience with the FSD Beta over the last seven days has made a few things clear: it’s very much a beta, but it’s very, very impressive when it works.

more…

The post Full Self-Driving Diary: A longtime Tesla driver’s perspective on FSD beta appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla is again found guilty of throttling charging speed, asked to pay $14,000 to owners in retrial
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:

In Norway, the company is asked to pay ~$14,000 to affected owners in a retrial of the process, which Tesla is going to appeal.

item.title: 3 things I learned on a rural Florida road trip in my Tesla Model 3
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lewis
item.description:
I recently drove from St. Petersburg, Florida, to Tallahassee, Florida, and back in my Tesla Model 3. It’s a five-hour drive each way, and it was my first real road trip longer in my EV. Here are three things I learned.

more…

The post 3 things I learned on a rural Florida road trip in my Tesla Model 3 appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla enables in-car purchases and subscriptions
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has started to enable in-car purchases and subscriptions in its latest software updates.

Owners can buy a “Premium Connectivity” straight from their center console inside Tesla vehicles.

more…

The post Tesla enables in-car purchases and subscriptions appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla Cybertruck will have yoke steering wheel, Elon Musk says will be a ‘tech bandwagon’
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Elon Musk confirmed that the Tesla Cybertruck will have a yoke steering wheel, and he also said that the electric pickup truck will be a “technology bandwagon.”

It could mean that it will have a better version of the new steering wheel.

more…

The post Tesla Cybertruck will have yoke steering wheel, Elon Musk says will be a ‘tech bandwagon’ appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla fans should reframe the issue of the $4,500 incentive for electric cars made by unions
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
The US Senate is now discussing the Build Back Better Act, which includes a much-needed reform of the federal EV incentive. Tesla fans are furious about the $4,500 additional incentive for electric cars made by unions.

They see it as one more attack by the Biden administration on Tesla, but they should reframe the issue to highlight the fundamental problem with the new policy.

more…

The post Tesla fans should reframe the issue of the $4,500 incentive for electric cars made by unions appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla is rumored to get green light at Gigafactory Berlin any day; already some Model Ys produced
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla is rumored to finally get the green light to start production at Gigafactory Berlin any day now, according to a new report coming out of Germany.

The report even suggests some production numbers for the early ramp-up.

more…

The post Tesla is rumored to get green light at Gigafactory Berlin any day; already some Model Ys produced appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Elon Musk tells Tesla (TSLA) employees to worry more about cost than delivery wave this quarter
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Elon Musk stayed true to his word and told Tesla employees not to worry as much about delivering as many cars as possible during this end-of-quarter delivery wave and instead focus on cost.

It’s a significant change to what has been Tesla’s strategy for years.

more…

The post Elon Musk tells Tesla (TSLA) employees to worry more about cost than delivery wave this quarter appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla withdraws application for $1B in subsidies for German factory, Musk implies they don’t want it
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has withdrawn an application for over $1 billion in subsidies for battery production at Gigafactory Berlin.

CEO Elon Musk appears to imply that Tesla withdrew because they don’t want government subsidies, but there are other theories.

more…

The post Tesla withdraws application for $1B in subsidies for German factory, Musk implies they don’t want it appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla is investing almost $200 million to expand Gigafactory Shanghai and hire 4,000 people
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has indicated that it plans to invest almost $200 million to expand Gigafactory Shanghai and hire 4,000 more people.

more…

The post Tesla is investing almost $200 million to expand Gigafactory Shanghai and hire 4,000 people appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: A Tesla Model S Plaid becomes first to hit 8-second quarter-mile
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
A Tesla Model S Plaid has become the first Tesla vehicle to hit an eight-second quarter-mile.

By some definition, it’s also the first “production car” to achieve a quarter-mile time under nine full seconds.

more…

The post A Tesla Model S Plaid becomes first to hit 8-second quarter-mile appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla begins Model Y Performance deliveries in China
item.dc:creator: Scooter Doll
item.description:
After teasing the move earlier this week, Tesla has begun deliveries of the Performance Model Y in China. The move comes with price hikes to the other Tesla models as the American automaker has fallen victim to continued supply chain issues.

more…

The post Tesla begins Model Y Performance deliveries in China appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla unveils $20,000 Carbon Ceramic Brake Kit for Model S Plaid
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:

more…

item.title: Tesla (TSLA) sends ultimatum to buyers who keep delaying deliveries
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has started to send an ultimatum to buyers who keep delaying their deliveries as part of a new policy change in the evolving market.

more…

item.title: Elon Musk has now unloaded about $10 billion of Tesla (TSLA) stock
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold more Tesla (TSLA) stock this week, bringing the total he has now unloaded to about $10 billion.

More sales are expected to come.

item.title: Tesla increases prices globally as supply chain issues persist
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has increased Model 3 and Model Y prices in several more international markets, including some critical ones like China and Canada.

Pressure from supply chain problems is assumed to be responsible.

more…

The post Tesla increases prices globally as supply chain issues persist appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla is offering free Supercharging in off-peak hours to help alleviate holiday traffic
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla announced that it is offering free Supercharging during off-peak hours in California to help alleviate holiday traffic and avoid long wait times at Superchargers.

more…

The post Tesla is offering free Supercharging in off-peak hours to help alleviate holiday traffic appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla asks Full Self-Driving Beta drivers to accept being recorded in case of a crash or ‘safety risk’
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla is now asking owners getting into the Full Self-Driving Beta program to accept that Tesla can use footage from both inside and outside the car in case of a safety risk or accident.

It’s the first time that Tesla will attach footage to specific individuals.

more…

The post Tesla asks Full Self-Driving Beta drivers to accept being recorded in case of a crash or ‘safety risk’ appeared first on Electrek.

item.title: Tesla employees are reportedly organizing a union at Gigafactory Berlin
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Some Tesla employees are reportedly organizing a union at Gigafactory Berlin, and IG Metall – one of Germany’s most powerful unions – is behind it.

more…

item.title: Tesla Model X gets turned into war machine with dual machine guns coming out of the falcon wings
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:

item.title: Tesla Cybertruck reservation backlog reaches $80 billion in value based on latest tally
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Based on the latest tally, Tesla has a backlog of over 1.2 million Cybertruck reservations worth over $80 billion.

But there’s still no production in sight.

item.title: Tesla files for Gigafactory Texas approval, reveals budget for first phase
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Tesla has filed for approval of the first phase of Gigafactory Texas with the Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation.

It reveals the budget and completion date for the first phase of the factory set to produce the Model Y.

item.title: Tesla will bring the new Model S Plaid to China early next year, says Elon Musk
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Elon Musk confirmed that Tesla has plans to bring the new Model S Plaid to China early next year. The automaker’s flagship sedan could prove popular in the country.

item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:

It includes some interesting new features based on the release notes, which you can find below.

item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert

Tesla has deployed a new Supercharger station in Alaska. It’s the first in the state and now means there is a Supercharger station in every state.

item.title: Tesla (TSLA) is in a position to grab $2.5 trillion of EV market, says top analyst
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
Dan Ives from Wedbush, one of the top 10 ranked stock analysts in the world, has increased his price target on Tesla’s stock (TSLA) as he believes the automaker will take a significant part of the growing EV market.

item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:

Over the last year, Tesla appeared to be accelerating Powerwall deployment.

item.description:

EV stocks are doing great, with Rivian also up – now worth north of $145 billion.

item.title: Tesla (TSLA) is being sued for $162M by JPMorgan as Musk’s ‘funding secured’ tweet still haunts them
item.dc:creator: Fred Lambert
item.description:
New court filings revealed that Tesla is currently fighting a $162 million lawsuit from JPMorgan over some expired warrants that the bank claims were affected by Elon Musk’s “funding secured” tweet in 2018.

more…
